pr_title: Fix AuthSuccessHandler to use HttpRequest and HttpResponse

timeline.message:
[WIP] Fix AuthSuccessHandler to use HttpRequest and HttpResponse
Motivation:
Related: #2323

timeline.bodyText:
I have a question about this. Because I have changed to this to use HttpRequest only,
(I should've done this in #2323) is there any chance that a user might not want to return different status than 401?
If so, I was wondering if we can guide them to use HttpResponseException or HttpStatusException.
And remove these handlers and just add sort of AuthorizingStrategy with a builder, so that a user just can return true or false. 🤔
timeline.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: Not sure I understand the question but I don't think we need a new strategy since we have Authorizer. These handlers seem clearer to me than throwing exceptions in the authorizer to me, and should have better performance.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
Ah yes, I should've made it clear before I ask a question. I was sort of thinking like:

Change Authorizer to AuthorizingStrategy

The new strategy can have multiple Authorizers inside to check.


Remove AuthSuccessHandler and AuthFailureHandler.

All these changes are based on that there's not so much chance that a user wants to send a different response other than 401, but I guess not. 😆
So yes, let's keep this as it is.
replies.author: minwoox
